_exec_summary.SummaryText: The following executive summary was prepared in accordance with 68.155 by the owner/operator of the South Dakota Wheat Growers Association - Mellette, SD.  The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association management and employees of the Mellette, SD facility have implemented a variety of standard operating procedures, safe work practices, training programs, and maintenance procedures designed to protect people, property and the environment.  The facility complies with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111 Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  In the event of an emergency accidental release, it is the policy of the management of the Mellette, SD facility to notify the City of Mellette Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency situation.  The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Mellette, SD facility stores and handles anhydrous ammonia for production of crops.  Anhydrous ammonia and liqified propane gas is a product regulated by Part 68 of the CAA and are in use at this facility at regulated quantities.  The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Mellette, SD facility's anhydrous accidental release prevention program complies with the Environmental Protection Agency accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with Occupational Safety and Health Adminsitrations (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111 Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia,  American Society of Testing Materials (ASTM), American National Standards Institute (ANSI), and American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) standards and regulations. The South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Mellette, SD facility has never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.   The S

outh Dakota Wheat Growers Association Mellette, SD facility emergency response program complies with OSHA 1910.138.  In the event of an emergency involving the anhydrous ammonia,  it is our policy to notify Mellette Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.   The management of this facility has discussed this policy with the fire department and members of the fire department are aware of our anhydrous ammonia.  In addition, it is our policy to contact the Spink County Emergency Manager.  The management and employees of the South Dakota Wheat Growers Association Mellette, SD facility periodically review procedures, policies, equipment and design, and safety program elements to evaluate improvements.
